description.p: Notolog is an open-source Markdown editor built with Python and PySide6. It features an integrated AI assistant, syntax highlighting, encryption support, and on-device LLM integration.

ul.li: Clean, distraction-free Markdown editing
AI assistant with on-device LLM support (ONNX, llama.cpp)
File encryption for sensitive notes
Syntax highlighting and live preview
Multi-language support
Cross-platform (Linux, macOS, Windows)
Added support for admonition notes with themed styling
Added GPU to CPU fallback for ONNX models on insufficient VRAM
Added hardware acceleration support for On Device LLM module
Improved error handling and memory management for AI modules
Improved view mode styling with updated margins and spacing
Removed trailing newlines from code blocks
Fixed font size updates now properly refresh view mode content
Fixed AI model loading blocking the UI thread
Automatic GPU to CPU fallback for ONNX models when VRAM is insufficient
Graceful handling of model loading cancellation
Improved error handling for GPU memory allocation failures
Added Indonesian language support
Added hardware acceleration (CPU, CUDA, DirectML, OpenVINO, CoreML, TensorRT, QNN, MIGraphX)
Added CPU/GPU inference mode icon indicator in AI Assistant status bar
Updated OpenAI model list with latest models
Added model loading status messages for AI modules
Added comprehensive documentation (getting started, user guide, API reference)
Improved AI Assistant signal handling and resource cleanup
Now requires Python 3.10 or later
First public .deb package release
Improved search form behavior during text editing
Fixed status bar navigation arrow colors across all themes
